# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_reduce_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    sum_ptr,
    sum_sq_ptr,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    block_sum = tl.sum(x, axis=0)
    block_sum_sq = tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    tl.atomic_add(sum_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum)
    tl.atomic_add(sum_sq_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum_sq)

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_forward_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    weight_ptr,
    bias_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    var_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    eps,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    mean = tl.load(mean_ptr + pid_batch)
    var_val = tl.load(var_ptr + pid_batch)
    std_inv = tl.math.rsqrt(var_val + eps)
    
    x_normalized = (x - mean) * std_inv
    
    w_ptrs = weight_ptr + offsets
    b_ptrs = bias_ptr + offsets
    w = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    b = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    out = x_normalized * w + b
    out_ptrs = output_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    tl.store(out_ptrs, out, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super().__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_ndim = len(self.normalized_shape)
        batch_dims = input_shape[:-normalized_ndim]
        batch_size = math.prod(batch_dims)
        N = math.prod(self.normalized_shape)
        
        x_flat = x.reshape(batch_size, N)
        sums = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        sum_sqs = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        BLOCK_SIZE = 4096
        grid_reduce = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_reduce_kernel[grid_reduce](
            x_flat, sums, sum_sqs, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        mean = sums / N
        variance = (sum_sqs / N) - (mean * mean)
        
        output_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        grid_forward = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_forward_kernel[grid_forward](
            x_flat, weight_flat, bias_flat, mean, variance, output_flat, 
            self.eps, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output_flat.reshape(input_shape)

batch_size = 16
features = 64
dim1 = 256
dim2 = 256

def get_inputs():
    x = torch.randn(batch_size, features, dim1, dim2)
    return [x]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [(features, dim1, dim2)]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================

full_rewrite_user.system:
You are a Triton GPU core optimization engineer deeply familiar with NVIDIA H100/H800 architecture.

==================== Context ====================
• Dataset: 250 kernelbench/level1-level5 *.py files  
  - Level1: simplest, Level5: most complex  
• Each file contains PyTorch reference (reference_code)  
• Goal: Generate functionally equivalent but faster Triton implementations (custom_code)  
• Evaluation pipeline:
    1) /verify_plus - Verify compilation & correctness  
    2) /execute (optional) - Return terminal logs if compilation fails  
    3) Scoring:  
      - Speedup > 1 required for points  
      - Score = (speed_up - 1) × 100  
• GPU Hardware: NVIDIA L20Y / H800 (same SM8.9 as H100)  
  - 3 TB/s HBM3 bandwidth  
  - FP16 Tensor Core 32×16×16  

==================== Evolution Phases ====================
① Phase 1 [Compilation Pass]  
  - Make Triton code compile (performance irrelevant)  
② Phase 2 [Numerical Correctness]  
  - Output must match PyTorch reference within float32 tolerance  
③ Phase 3 [Performance Gain]  
  - Target ≥5% speedup (≥15% = exceptional)  
  - Official scoring based on speed_up field  

The Evolution system will pass the EVOLVE-BLOCK from the previous version.  
Modify ONLY the Triton kernel source within this block - all other code is LOCKED.

==================== Constraints (MUST OBEY) ====================
❌ NEVER change @triton.jit function signatures or parameter names  
❌ NEVER modify grid configuration, output tensor shapes, or PID logic  
❌ NEVER remove boundary checks or out-of-bound masks  
❌ NEVER introduce race conditions, uninitialized reads, or sync gaps  

✅ Allowed Optimizations (Examples):  
  • Memory coalescing optimizations & vectorized tl.load/tl.store  
  • Replace staged softmax with online/FlashAttention variants  
  • Adaptive tuning: BLOCK_M/BLOCK_N/BLOCK_K dimensions  
  • Multi-query-head batch processing (GQA, 5:1 patterns)  
  • Shared/L2 buffering, Tensor Core alignment (FP16/bf16/tf32)  
  • Stride precomputation & pointer caching  

==================== Output Format ====================
Return ONLY the complete updated code containing the EVOLVE-BLOCK comment marker.  
NO explanations, NO markdown, NO additional text.
Name the output structure class as ModelNew.

==================== Optimization Tips ====================
• If previous compile failed: Fix syntax/mask/stride errors first  
• If correctness fails: Prioritize bounds mask & dtype precision  
• When speed_up < 1: Focus on memory access & block sizing  
• Small iterative steps: Modify ≤20 lines per revision  
• Maintain reversibility between versions
Here is an example to show you how to rewrite a PyTorch implementation that quantizes a high-precision tensor to int8 dtype with row-wise granularity into a Triton implementation: 
The original PyTorch implementation is as follows: 
``` 
import torch
def per_row_quantize_int8(x: torch.Tensor) -> tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]:
    x_amax = x.abs().float().amax(dim=1).clamp(min=1e-4)
    scale = 127 / x_amax
    output = (x * scale[:, None]).round().clamp(-127, 127).to(torch.int8)
    output_scale = x_amax / 127

    return output, output_scale
``` 
The corresponding Triton-rewritten implementation is as follows: 
``` 
import math
import torch
import triton
import triton.language as tl
from triton.language.extra import libdevice

# rowwise quantize

@triton.autotune(
    configs=[
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=1, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=2, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=4, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=8, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=1),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=2),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=4),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=1),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=2),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=4),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=8),
    ],
    key=["n_elements"],
)

@triton.jit
def _quantize_rowwise(
    x_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    output_scale,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
    P2: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid = tl.program_id(axis=0)
    block_start = pid * BLOCK_SIZE
    arange = tl.arange(0, P2)
    offsets = block_start + arange
    row_mask = arange < BLOCK_SIZE
    x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=row_mask)

    abs_x = tl.abs(x)
    max_val = tl.max(tl.where(row_mask, abs_x, 0), axis=0)
    output = libdevice.llrint(127.0 * (x / max_val))
    tl.store(output_ptr + offsets, output, mask=row_mask)
    tl.store(output_scale + pid, max_val / 127)


def per_row_quantize_int8(x: torch.Tensor):
    x = x.contiguous()
    output = torch.empty(*x.shape, device=x.device, dtype=torch.int8)
    output_scale = torch.empty(x.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
    P2 = int(2 ** (math.ceil(math.log2(x.shape[1]))))
    grid = lambda x: (x.shape[0],)
    _quantize_rowwise[grid](x, output, output_scale, BLOCK_SIZE=x.shape[1], P2=P2)

    return output, output_scale


    
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,  # Input tensor pointer
    y_ptr,  # Output tensor pointer
    w_ptr,  # Weight tensor pointer
    b_ptr,  # Bias tensor pointer
    stride_x_batch: tl.constexpr,  # Stride between rows
    n_elements: tl.constexpr,     # Number of elements per row
    eps: tl.constexpr,            # Epsilon for numerical stability
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,     # Processing block size
):
    # Get row index
    row_idx = tl.program_id(0)
    row_start_ptr = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_x_batch
    
    # Initialize accumulators
    mean_acc = 0.0
    sq_acc = 0.0
    
    # First pass: compute mean and squared sum
    for offset in range(0, n_elements, BLOCK_SIZE):
        cols = offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols < n_elements
        x = tl.load(row_start_ptr + cols, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        mean_acc += tl.sum(x, axis=0)
        sq_acc += tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    # Compute final mean and variance
    mean = mean_acc / n_elements
    variance = sq_acc / n_elements - mean * mean
    inv_std = 1.0 / tl.sqrt(variance + eps)
    
    # Second pass: normalize and transform
    for offset in range(0, n_elements, BLOCK_SIZE):
        cols = offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols < n_elements
        x = tl.load(row_start_ptr + cols, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        
        # Normalize
        normalized = (x - mean) * inv_std
        
        # Apply affine transformation
        w = tl.load(w_ptr + cols, mask=mask)
        b = tl.load(b_ptr + cols, mask=mask)
        y = normalized * w + b
        
        tl.store(y_ptr + row_idx * stride_x_batch + cols, y, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super().__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        # Flatten input except batch dimension
        reshaped_x = x.reshape(x.size(0), -1)
        normalized_size = reshaped_x.size(1)
        y = torch.empty_like(reshaped_x)
        
        # Flatten parameters
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        # Configure kernel launch grid
        grid = (x.size(0),)
        
        # Launch Triton kernel with optimized block size
        block_size = min(triton.next_power_of_2(normalized_size), 4096)
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            reshaped_x, y, weight_flat, bias_flat,
            reshaped_x.stride(0), normalized_size, self.eps,
            BLOCK_SIZE=block_size,
            num_warps=8
        )
        
        return y.reshape(x.shape)

batch_size = 16
features = 64
dim1 = 256
dim2 = 256

def get_inputs():
    x = torch.randn(batch_size, features, dim1, dim2)
    return [x]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [(features, dim1, dim2)]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
```

```python
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_reduce_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    sum_ptr,
    sum_sq_ptr,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    block_sum = tl.sum(x, axis=0)
    block_sum_sq = tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    tl.atomic_add(sum_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum)
    tl.atomic_add(sum_sq_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum_sq)

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_forward_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    weight_ptr,
    bias_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    var_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    eps,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    mean = tl.load(mean_ptr + pid_batch)
    var_val = tl.load(var_ptr + pid_batch)
    std = tl.sqrt(var_val + eps)
    
    x_normalized = (x - mean) / std
    
    w_ptrs = weight_ptr + offsets
    b_ptrs = bias_ptr + offsets
    w = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    b = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    out = x_normalized * w + b
    out_ptrs = output_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    tl.store(out_ptrs, out, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.eps = 1e-5
        self.gamma = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(normalized_shape))
        self.beta = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(normalized_shape))
        
    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_ndim = len(self.normalized_shape)
        batch_dims = input_shape[:-normalized_ndim]
        batch_size = math.prod(batch_dims)
        N = math.prod(self.normalized_shape)
        
        x_flat = x.reshape(batch_size, N)
        sums = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        sum_sqs = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        BLOCK_SIZE = 4096
        grid_reduce = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_reduce_kernel[grid_reduce](
            x_flat, sums, sum_sqs, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        mean = sums / N
        variance = (sum_sqs / N) - (mean * mean)
        
        output_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        gamma_flat = self.gamma.expand_as(x).reshape(-1)
        beta_flat = self.beta.expand_as(x).reshape(-1)
        
        grid_forward = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_forward_kernel[grid_forward](
            x_flat, gamma_flat, beta_flat, mean, variance, output_flat, 
            self.eps, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output_flat.reshape(input_shape)
```

### Program 3 (Score: 20.0000)
```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,
    gamma_ptr,
    beta_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    rstd_ptr,
    N,  # Total elements in normalized dimension
    eps,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    x_ptr += pid * N
    output_ptr += pid * N

    # Initialize accumulators
    total_sum = 0.0
    total_sum_sq = 0.0

    # Combined pass for mean and variance
    for off in range(0, N, BLOCK_SIZE):
        offsets = off + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = offsets < N
        x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        total_sum += tl.sum(x, axis=0)
        total_sum_sq += tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)

    # Compute statistics
    mean = total_sum / N
    var = total_sum_sq / N - mean * mean
    rstd = 1.0 / tl.sqrt(var + eps)

    # Store statistics
    tl.store(mean_ptr + pid, mean)
    tl.store(rstd_ptr + pid, rstd)

    # Normalize and scale
    for off in range(0, N, BLOCK_SIZE):
        offsets = off + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = offsets < N
        x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        g = tl.load(gamma_ptr + offsets, mask=mask)
        b = tl.load(beta_ptr + offsets, mask=mask)
        x_hat = (x - mean) * rstd
        y = x_hat * g + b
        tl.store(output_ptr + offsets, y, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.eps = 1e-5
        self.gamma = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(normalized_shape))
        self.beta = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(normalized_shape))
        
    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_dims = input_shape[-len(self.normalized_shape):]
        N = math.prod(normalized_dims)
        x_flat = x.contiguous().view(-1, N)
        
        mean = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        rstd = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        gamma_flat = self.gamma.expand_as(x).contiguous().view(-1)
        beta_flat = self.beta.expand_as(x).contiguous().view(-1)
        
        output_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        
        grid = (x_flat.shape[0],)
        BLOCK_SIZE = min(4096, N)
        
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            x_flat, gamma_flat, beta_flat, output_flat, mean, rstd, 
            N, self.eps, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output_flat.view(input_shape)

batch_size = 16
features = 64
dim1 = 256
dim2 = 256

def get_inputs():
    x = torch.randn(batch_size, features, dim1, dim2)
    return [x]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [(features, dim1, dim2)]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
```

```python
import math
import torch

import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,
    y_ptr,
    w_ptr,
    b_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    rstd_ptr,
    stride_xb,
    stride_xh,
    n_cols,
    eps,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    row_idx = tl.program_id(0)
    cols_offsets = tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = cols_offsets < n_cols
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh
    w_ptrs = w_ptr + cols_offsets
    b_ptrs = b_ptr + cols_offsets
    
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    weight = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    bias = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    
    mean = tl.sum(x, axis=0) / n_cols
    x_centered = tl.where(mask, x - mean, 0.0)
    var = tl.sum(x_centered * x_centered, axis=0) / n_cols
    rstd = tl.math.rsqrt(var + eps)
    
    y = (x_centered * rstd) * weight + bias
    
    tl.store(y_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh, y, mask=mask)
    tl.store(mean_ptr + row_idx, mean)
    tl.store(rstd_ptr + row_idx, rstd)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        original_shape = x.shape
        flattened_size = math.prod(original_shape[1:])
        x_flat = x.reshape(-1, flattened_size).contiguous()
        
        mean = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        rstd = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        y_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        n_rows, n_cols = x_flat.shape
        BLOCK_SIZE = triton.next_power_of_2(n_cols)
        BLOCK_SIZE = min(BLOCK_SIZE, 4096)
        
        grid = (n_rows,)
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            x_flat,
            y_flat,
            weight_flat,
            bias_flat,
            mean,
            rstd,
            x_flat.stride(0),
            x_flat.stride(1),
            n_cols,
            self.eps,
            BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return y_flat.reshape(original_shape)
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit(num_warps=8)
def _layer_norm_reduce_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    sum_ptr,
    sum_sq_ptr,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    block_sum = tl.sum(x, axis=0)
    block_sum_sq = tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    tl.atomic_add(sum_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum)
    tl.atomic_add(sum_sq_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum_sq)

@triton.jit(num_warps=8)
def _layer_norm_forward_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    weight_ptr,
    bias_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    var_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    eps,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    mean = tl.load(mean_ptr + pid_batch)
    var_val = tl.load(var_ptr + pid_batch)
    std_inv = tl.math.rsqrt(var_val + eps)
    
    x_normalized = (x - mean) * std_inv
    
    w_ptrs = weight_ptr + offsets
    b_ptrs = bias_ptr + offsets
    w = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    b = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    out = x_normalized * w + b
    out_ptrs = output_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    tl.store(out_ptrs, out, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super().__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_ndim = len(self.normalized_shape)
        batch_dims = input_shape[:-normalized_ndim]
        batch_size = 1
        for d in batch_dims:
            batch_size *= d
        N = 1
        for d in self.normalized_shape:
            N *= d
            
        x_flat = x.reshape(batch_size, N)
        sums = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        sum_sqs = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        BLOCK_SIZE = 4096
        grid_reduce = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_reduce_kernel[grid_reduce](x_flat, sums, sum_sqs, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE)
        
        mean = sums / N
        variance = (sum_sqs / N) - (mean * mean)
        
        output = torch.empty_like(x)
        output_flat = output.reshape(batch_size, N)
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        grid_forward = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_forward_kernel[grid_forward](
            x_flat, weight_flat, bias_flat, mean, variance, output_flat, self.eps, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,  # Input tensor pointer
    y_ptr,  # Output tensor pointer
    w_ptr,  # Weight tensor pointer
    b_ptr,  # Bias tensor pointer
    stride_x_batch: tl.constexpr,  # Stride between rows
    n_elements: tl.constexpr,     # Number of elements per row
    eps: tl.constexpr,            # Epsilon for numerical stability
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,     # Processing block size
):
    # Get row index
    row_idx = tl.program_id(0)
    row_start_ptr = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_x_batch
    
    # Initialize accumulators
    mean_acc = 0.0
    sq_acc = 0.0
    
    # First pass: compute mean and squared sum
    for offset in range(0, n_elements, BLOCK_SIZE):
        cols = offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols < n_elements
        x = tl.load(row_start_ptr + cols, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        mean_acc += tl.sum(x, axis=0)
        sq_acc += tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    # Compute final mean and variance
    mean = mean_acc / n_elements
    variance = sq_acc / n_elements - mean * mean
    inv_std = 1.0 / tl.sqrt(variance + eps)
    
    # Second pass: normalize and transform
    for offset in range(0, n_elements, BLOCK_SIZE):
        cols = offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols < n_elements
        x = tl.load(row_start_ptr + cols, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        
        # Normalize
        normalized = (x - mean) * inv_std
        
        # Apply affine transformation
        w = tl.load(w_ptr + cols, mask=mask)
        b = tl.load(b_ptr + cols, mask=mask)
        y = normalized * w + b
        
        tl.store(y_ptr + row_idx * stride_x_batch + cols, y, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super().__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        # Flatten input except batch dimension
        reshaped_x = x.reshape(x.size(0), -1)
        normalized_size = reshaped_x.size(1)
        y = torch.empty_like(reshaped_x)
        
        # Flatten parameters
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        # Configure kernel launch grid
        grid = (x.size(0),)
        
        # Launch Triton kernel with optimized block size
        block_size = min(triton.next_power_of_2(normalized_size), 4096)
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            reshaped_x, y, weight_flat, bias_flat,
            reshaped_x.stride(0), normalized_size, self.eps,
            BLOCK_SIZE=block_size,
            num_warps=8
        )
        
        return y.reshape(x.shape)
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,
    gamma_ptr,
    beta_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    rstd_ptr,
    N,  # Total elements in normalized dimension
    eps,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    x_ptr += pid * N
    output_ptr += pid * N

    # Initialize accumulators
    total_sum = 0.0
    total_sum_sq = 0.0

    # Combined pass for mean and variance
    for off in range(0, N, BLOCK_SIZE):
        offsets = off + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = offsets < N
        x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        total_sum += tl.sum(x, axis=0)
        total_sum_sq += tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)

    # Compute statistics
    mean = total_sum / N
    var = total_sum_sq / N - mean * mean
    rstd = 1.0 / tl.sqrt(var + eps)

    # Store statistics
    tl.store(mean_ptr + pid, mean)
    tl.store(rstd_ptr + pid, rstd)

    # Normalize and scale
    for off in range(0, N, BLOCK_SIZE):
        offsets = off + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = offsets < N
        x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        g = tl.load(gamma_ptr + offsets, mask=mask)
        b = tl.load(beta_ptr + offsets, mask=mask)
        x_hat = (x - mean) * rstd
        y = x_hat * g + b
        tl.store(output_ptr + offsets, y, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.eps = 1e-5
        self.gamma = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(normalized_shape))
        self.beta = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(normalized_shape))
        
    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_dims = input_shape[-len(self.normalized_shape):]
        N = math.prod(normalized_dims)
        x_flat = x.contiguous().view(-1, N)
        
        mean = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        rstd = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        gamma_flat = self.gamma.expand_as(x).contiguous().view(-1)
        beta_flat = self.beta.expand_as(x).contiguous().view(-1)
        
        output_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        
        grid = (x_flat.shape[0],)
        BLOCK_SIZE = min(4096, N)
        
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            x_flat, gamma_flat, beta_flat, output_flat, mean, rstd, 
            N, self.eps, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output_flat.view(input_shape)
```

```python
@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,
    y_ptr,
    w_ptr,
    b_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    rstd_ptr,
    stride_xb,
    stride_xh,
    n_cols,
    eps,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    row_idx = tl.program_id(0)
    # We'll use a loop to go over the row in chunks of BLOCK_SIZE

    # First, compute the mean and variance by looping over the row
    sum = 0.0
    sum_sq = 0.0
    num_blocks = tl.cdiv(n_cols, BLOCK_SIZE)
    for block_idx in range(0, num_blocks):
        col_offset = block_idx * BLOCK_SIZE
        cols_offsets = col_offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols_offsets < n_cols

        x_ptrs = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh
        x_chunk = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)

        sum += tl.sum(x_chunk, axis=0)
        sum_sq += tl.sum(x_chunk * x_chunk, axis=0)

    mean = sum / n_cols
    var = (sum_sq / n_cols) - (mean * mean)
    rstd = tl.math.rsqrt(var + eps)

    # Now, loop again to apply the normalization and store
    for block_idx in range(0, num_blocks):
        col_offset = block_idx * BLOCK_SIZE
        cols_offsets = col_offset + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = cols_offsets < n_cols

        x_ptrs = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh
        x_chunk = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)

        w_ptrs = w_ptr + cols_offsets
        b_ptrs = b_ptr + cols_offsets
        weight = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
        bias = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)

        x_normalized = (x_chunk - mean) * rstd
        y_chunk = x_normalized * weight + bias

        y_ptrs = y_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh
        tl.store(y_ptrs, y_chunk, mask=mask)

    tl.store(mean_ptr + row_idx, mean)
    tl.store(rstd_ptr + row_idx, rstd)
```

```python
        sum_sqs = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        BLOCK_SIZE = 4096
        grid_reduce = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_reduce_kernel[grid_reduce](x_flat, sums, sum_sqs, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE)
        
        mean = sums / N
        variance = (sum_sqs / N) - (mean * mean)
        
        output = torch.empty_like(x)
        output_flat = output.reshape(batch_size, N)
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        grid_forward = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_forward_kernel[grid_forward](
            x_flat, weight_flat, bias_flat, mean, variance, output_flat, self.eps, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output
```

# Current Program
```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_fwd(
    x_ptr,
    y_ptr,
    w_ptr,
    b_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    rstd_ptr,
    stride_xb,
    stride_xh,
    n_cols,
    eps,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    row_idx = tl.program_id(0)
    cols_offsets = tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = cols_offsets < n_cols
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh
    w_ptrs = w_ptr + cols_offsets
    b_ptrs = b_ptr + cols_offsets
    
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    weight = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    bias = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0).to(tl.float32)
    
    mean = tl.sum(x, axis=0) / n_cols
    x_centered = tl.where(mask, x - mean, 0.0)
    var = tl.sum(x_centered * x_centered, axis=0) / n_cols
    rstd = tl.math.rsqrt(var + eps)
    
    y = (x_centered * rstd) * weight + bias
    
    tl.store(y_ptr + row_idx * stride_xb + cols_offsets * stride_xh, y, mask=mask)
    tl.store(mean_ptr + row_idx, mean)
    tl.store(rstd_ptr + row_idx, rstd)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        original_shape = x.shape
        flattened_size = math.prod(original_shape[1:])
        x_flat = x.reshape(-1, flattened_size).contiguous()
        
        mean = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        rstd = torch.empty(x_flat.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        y_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        n_rows, n_cols = x_flat.shape
        BLOCK_SIZE = triton.next_power_of_2(n_cols)
        BLOCK_SIZE = min(BLOCK_SIZE, 4096)
        
        grid = (n_rows,)
        _layer_norm_fwd[grid](
            x_flat,
            y_flat,
            weight_flat,
            bias_flat,
            mean,
            rstd,
            x_flat.stride(0),
            x_flat.stride(1),
            n_cols,
            self.eps,
            BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return y_flat.reshape(original_shape)

    return [x]
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_reduce_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    sum_ptr,
    sum_sq_ptr,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    block_sum = tl.sum(x, axis=0)
    block_sum_sq = tl.sum(x * x, axis=0)
    
    tl.atomic_add(sum_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum)
    tl.atomic_add(sum_sq_ptr + pid_batch, block_sum_sq)

@triton.jit
def _layer_norm_forward_kernel(
    x_ptr,
    weight_ptr,
    bias_ptr,
    mean_ptr,
    var_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    eps,
    N: tl.constexpr,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid_batch = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_block = tl.program_id(1)
    
    block_start = pid_block * BLOCK_SIZE
    offsets = block_start + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
    mask = offsets < N
    
    x_ptrs = x_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    x = tl.load(x_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    mean = tl.load(mean_ptr + pid_batch)
    var_val = tl.load(var_ptr + pid_batch)
    std_inv = tl.math.rsqrt(var_val + eps)
    
    x_normalized = (x - mean) * std_inv
    
    w_ptrs = weight_ptr + offsets
    b_ptrs = bias_ptr + offsets
    w = tl.load(w_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    b = tl.load(b_ptrs, mask=mask, other=0.0)
    
    out = x_normalized * w + b
    out_ptrs = output_ptr + pid_batch * N + offsets
    tl.store(out_ptrs, out, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, normalized_shape: tuple):
        super().__init__()
        self.normalized_shape = normalized_shape
        self.weight = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(*normalized_shape))
        self.bias = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(*normalized_shape))
        self.eps = 1e-5

    def forward(self, x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
        input_shape = x.shape
        normalized_ndim = len(self.normalized_shape)
        batch_dims = input_shape[:-normalized_ndim]
        batch_size = math.prod(batch_dims)
        N = math.prod(self.normalized_shape)
        
        x_flat = x.reshape(batch_size, N)
        sums = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        sum_sqs = torch.zeros(batch_size, device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
        
        BLOCK_SIZE = 4096
        grid_reduce = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_reduce_kernel[grid_reduce](
            x_flat, sums, sum_sqs, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        mean = sums / N
        variance = (sum_sqs / N) - (mean * mean)
        
        output_flat = torch.empty_like(x_flat)
        weight_flat = self.weight.reshape(-1)
        bias_flat = self.bias.reshape(-1)
        
        grid_forward = (batch_size, triton.cdiv(N, BLOCK_SIZE))
        _layer_norm_forward_kernel[grid_forward](
            x_flat, weight_flat, bias_flat, mean, variance, output_flat, 
            self.eps, N, BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
        )
        
        return output_flat.reshape(input_shape)

dim2 = 256

    x = torch.randn(batch_size, features, dim1, dim2)
    return [x]

    return [(features, dim1, dim2)]
```
